items.title: backport os.samefile for python2.7 on windows
items.body: python 2.7 on windows lacks `os.samefile`. We should include it here for consistency.

items.title: contextmanagers.atomic_open_for_write assumes chmod never fails
items.body:
`contextmanagers.atomic_open_for_write` assumes chmod never fails, and so does not guard against possible exceptions:
https://github.com/sarugaku/vistir/blob/1bb1a6a9069b4e073554f6dae60d2bf634cf9b35/src/vistir/contextmanagers.py#L236-L237

Thus, when an exception is thrown, as it is when `chmod` is not allowed in a directory, the temporary file is left behind and the exception is propagated to the caller.

`PermissionError`, or perhaps `OSError`, should be caught and dealt with (or ignored) here.

items.title: Add github release action
items.body: We should use github releases as they are much easier to manage

items.title: Make requests an optional dependency
items.body:
The only use of requests is for downloading a file in `vistir.contextmanagers.open_file`, which can be handled in full using `urllib` or `urllib2`. As such, I think it's appropriate for `requests` to become an optional extra.

See sarugaku/pythonfinder#78 for reference

items.title: Spinner should not exit after failure
items.body: The signal handler in the spinner is causing a deadlock on windows due to attempting to prematurely exit at runtime. We don't even actually want to exit here, so we should just stop trying.

items.title: Run should handle keyboard interrupts and also raise any handled exceptions
items.body: Currently exceptions are suppressed after being handled, but they should be raised

items.title: TimeoutError does not exist on Python 2.7
normalize_path should resolve shortened windows paths
items.body: shortened windows paths should be expanded by `vistir.path.normalize_path` otherwise the same two files may be represented differently on the filesystem

items.title: Color-wrapping console handler fails to pass through critical attributes on windows
items.body:
stream `fileno` and buffer access are not available on windows

in addition, `echo` calls attempt to re-wrap the stream unnecessarily

items.title: Icacls command is ordered incorrectly
items.body: The file path needs to be the first argument, not the `grant` argument

items.title: Add error handling for keyboard interrupts during subprocess calls
items.body: Blocking subprocess calls do not currently handle keyboard interrupts correctly, instead leaving open handles and failing to terminate

items.title: The Color Stream Wrapper is applying color wrappings when not appropriate
Windows chmod ignores anything besides read permissions
items.body:
From the [chmod documentation](https://docs.python.org/3.7/library/os.html#os.chmod)

>Note
>
>Although Windows supports chmod(), you can only set the file’s read-only flag with it (via the stat.S_IWRITE and stat.S_IREAD constants or a corresponding integer value). All other bits are ignored.

items.title: Add proper handler for generating console stream wrappers on windows
items.body: - We currently don't wrap streams on windows properly, we should do this

items.title: Python 2 NamedTemporaryFile
items.body:
Firstly, in `tempfile.py` there is

```py
    def _infer_return_type(*args):
        _types = set()
        for arg in args:
            if isinstance(type(arg), six.string_types):
                _types.add(str)
            elif isinstance(type(arg), bytes):
                _types.add(bytes)
            elif arg:
                _types.add(type(arg))
```

Worth noting that the final `elif arg` means any use of `u''` or `b''` is ignored.  This is different from stdlib, but probably not a bad thing.  There are also other differences with this implementations vs the stdlib one, resulting in lots of errors when testing this implementation of `_infer_return_type` with the stdlib test class `TestLowLevelInternals`.

But the important part to note is that `unicode` input results in `unicode` as the inferred type.  `isinstance(type(u'foo'), six.string_types)` is `False`.

`os.fsencode` doesnt exist on Python 2, so any use of `unicode` as args to the local `NamedTemporaryFile` will result in an error.

This also applies to `create_tracked_tempfile`, which passes all args through to `NamedTemporaryFile`.

Copying the example from the doctest in the `README.rst` and `docs/quickstart.rst`, and making them `unicode_literals`...

```python
>>> temp_file = vistir.path.create_tracked_tempfile(prefix=u"requirements", suffix=u"txt")

tests/test_path.py:90:
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
src/vistir/path.py:306: in create_tracked_tempfile
    return _NamedTemporaryFile(*args, **kwargs)
src/vistir/backports/tempfile.py:192: in NamedTemporaryFile
    prefix, suffix, dir, output_type = _sanitize_params(prefix, suffix, dir)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

prefix = 'requirements', suffix = 'txt', dir = None

    def _sanitize_params(prefix, suffix, dir):
        """Common parameter processing for most APIs in this module."""
        output_type = _infer_return_type(prefix, suffix, dir)
        if suffix is None:
            suffix = output_type()
        if prefix is None:
            if output_type is str:
                prefix = "tmp"
            else:
                prefix = os.fsencode("tmp")
        if dir is None:
            if output_type is str:
                dir = gettempdir()
            else:
>               dir = os.fsencode(gettempdir())
E               AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'fsencode'

src/vistir/backports/tempfile.py:51: AttributeError
```

`atomic_open_for_write(u'foo/bar', ...)` doesnt hit this, as it supplies a `dir` and a `prefix`.

You can partially remove this problem by substituting `os.fsencode("tmp")` for `b'tmp'` , as that is a no-brainer you dont need `os.fsencode` for.

Removing `os.fsencode(gettempdir())` will be more difficult/intrusive, depending on the implementation goals.  The main source of problems is `gettempdir` uses `_candidate_tempdir_list()`  which first tries envvars `TMPDIR`, `TEMP`, and `TMP`, so anything is possible.  It could be re-implemented to only use those envvars if they are paths which resolve correctly without using `os.fsencode`, perhaps falling back to the OS default paths which are saner.

Or, use `backports.os.fsencode` , but be aware of https://github.com/PiDelport/backports.os/issues/13 , and I've also encountered other problems with it while working on https://github.com/PiDelport/backports.tempfile/pull/7 , but I havent identified that problem as clearly atm, eluding to it only a code comment.

items.title: TemporaryDirectory rmtree error handler should ignore errors
items.body: We used to ignore errors when failing to remove temporary directories, but regressed this behavior recently.

items.title: Spinner encoding attempts to encode strings too many times, causing failures on python 2
items.body:
```console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/hawk/.pyenv/versions/2.7.16/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 801, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/home/hawk/.pyenv/versions/2.7.16/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 754, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/home/hawk/git/pipenv/pipenv/vendor/vistir/spin.py", line 369, in _spin
    out = self._compose_out(spin_phase)
  File "/home/hawk/git/pipenv/pipenv/vendor/vistir/spin.py", line 352, in _compose_out
    out = decode_output("\r{0} {1}".format(frame, text))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u280b' in position 0: ordinal not in range(128)
```

items.title: test_spinner fails with colorama 0.3.3
items.body:
When colorama is 0.3.3, ...

```py
__________________________ test_spinner[False-False] ___________________________

monkeypatch = <_pytest.monkeypatch.MonkeyPatch object at 0x7fc2bb3d4550>
nospin = False, write_to_stdout = False

    @pytest.mark.parametrize("nospin, write_to_stdout", (
        (True, True), (True, False),
        (False, True), (False, False)
    ))
    def test_spinner(monkeypatch, nospin, write_to_stdout):
        with replaced_stream("stdout") as stdout:
            with replaced_stream("stderr") as stderr:
                with monkeypatch.context() as m:
                    # m.setenv("VISTIR_DISABLE_COLORS", "1")
                    import vistir.spin
                    with vistir.spin.create_spinner(
                        spinner_name="bouncingBar", text="Running...", nospin=nospin,
                        write_to_stdout=write_to_stdout
                    ) as spinner:
                        time.sleep(3)
                        spinner.ok("Ok!")
                    out = stdout.getvalue().strip(vistir.spin.CLEAR_LINE).strip()
                    err = stderr.getvalue().strip(vistir.spin.CLEAR_LINE).strip()
                    if write_to_stdout:
                        assert "Ok!" in out.strip().splitlines()[-1], out
                        assert err.strip() == "", err
                    else:
>                       assert "Ok!" in err.strip().splitlines()[-1], err
E                       IndexError: list index out of range

tests/test_spinner.py:30: IndexError
```

items.title: test_ensure_mkdir_p: OSError: [Errno 36] File name too long
items.body:
https://travis-ci.org/jayvdb/vistir/jobs/504095856 Python 3.6

```console
_____________________________ test_ensure_mkdir_p ______________________________
    @given(legal_path_chars(), legal_path_chars())
>   @example(base_dir=u'0', subdir=u'\x80')
    @settings(suppress_health_check=(HealthCheck.filter_too_much,))
    def test_ensure_mkdir_p(base_dir, subdir):
tests/test_path.py:49: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
tests/test_path.py:62: in test_ensure_mkdir_p
    target = join_with_dir(base_dir, subdir)
src/vistir/path.py:255: in decorated
    mkdir_p(path, mode=mode)
src/vistir/path.py:244: in mkdir_p
    os.makedirs(os.path.join(head, tail), mode)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
name = b'/tmp/tmp_nab54vs/0/\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\...80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80'
mode = 511, exist_ok = False
    def makedirs(name, mode=0o777, exist_ok=False):
        """makedirs(name [, mode=0o777][, exist_ok=False])
    
        Super-mkdir; create a leaf directory and all intermediate ones.  Works like
        mkdir, except that any intermediate path segment (not just the rightmost)
        will be created if it does not exist. If the target directory already
        exists, raise an OSError if exist_ok is False. Otherwise no exception is
        raised.  This is recursive.
    
        """
        head, tail = path.split(name)
        if not tail:
            head, tail = path.split(head)
        if head and tail and not path.exists(head):
            try:
                makedirs(head, mode, exist_ok)
            except FileExistsError:
                # Defeats race condition when another thread created the path
                pass
            cdir = curdir
            if isinstance(tail, bytes):
                cdir = bytes(curdir, 'ASCII')
            if tail == cdir:           # xxx/newdir/. exists if xxx/newdir exists
                return
        try:
>           mkdir(name, mode)
E           OSError: [Errno 36] File name too long: b'/tmp/tmp_nab54vs/0/\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80\xf0\x90\x80\x80'
../../../virtualenv/python3.6.3/lib/python3.6/os.py:220: OSError
```

items.title: backports.functools_lru_cache required on Python 3.4
items.body:
https://github.com/sarugaku/vistir/commit/4085f78fc42fbb53160aad170d5ab33d45492797 very explicitly made `backports.functools_lru_cache` necessary for python_version <= "3.4", in the dependency info and in the import guards.

I cant see a reason why py3.4 environments cant use the system lib version.

items.title: Issue with using "python" in bash
items.body:
Hi,
There is problem to running tests from test-misc.py in Fedora because in Fedora there is no usr/bin/python. Also it do not give you choice to run test in different python. I would suggest using sys.executable instead. If you want here is patch https://pagure.io/python-vistir/raw/master/f/python_to_sys.executable.patch

items.title: Break dependency on cursor
items.body: The `cursor` library was relicensed under the GPLv3.  Since we are vendoring vistir in pipenv, we need to break the dependency on cursor and reimplement it from scratch (pretty trivial, it just prints an ANSI code or grabs the output handle on windows and hides the cursor).

items.title: vistir.misc.run() not setting environment variables
items.body: vistir.misc.run() is not properly setting environment variables. PR to follow.

items.title: Fix handling of filesystem paths
items.body: Filesystem paths shouldn't be explicitly bytes encoded, but instead should be filesystem encoded and decoded according to `sys.getfilesystemencoding()` and should have error handling according to `sys.getfilesystemencodeerrors()` where available, `surrogatepass` on windows+python 3.2+, `replace` when encoding on windows+python2, `escape` when decoding on windows+python2, and `surrogateescape` on posix when `getfilesystemencodeerrors()` is not available.

items.title: Improve output decoding and translation to fail gracefully via replacement
items.body:
`decode_for_output` should attempt to decode properly before failing gracefully and replacing the target characters.

We should also accept translation maps in this function to allow replacement of specific non-ascii characters when we are dealing with failed translations.

items.title: Add additional items to `vistir.compat` that will need `six.moves` entries that are moving to `collections.abc`
items.body:
Some examples include:

`Iterable`, `Mapping`, `Sequence`, `Set`, `ItemsView`

items.title: exception handler during `_create_subprocess` failures doesn't intersperse strings properly
items.body: ref: pypa/pipenv#3363

items.title: Add a way to capture and replace system streams
items.body:
I find myself often needing to either substitute (for the purposes of capturing/wrapping) or prevent writing to `sys.stdout` or `sys.stderr` -- this library should really provide a mechanism for the following:

1. Wrapping streams with a `TextIOWrapper` that is compatible with python 2 and python 3
2. In so doing, make sure to use canonical encoding names if we need to resolve those
3. Provide a way to temporarily replace `sys.stdout` and `sys.stderr` to prevent other tools from writing to them

items.title: FileNotFoundError is not defined in rmtree
items.body: It should be imported from ```compat.py```

items.title: Add utility to check path membership and normalize paths
Provide option to redirect frozen spinner frame to stderr instead of stdout
items.body:
The spinner should provide the possibility of freezing the final frame to stderr instead of stdout

Ref: pypa/pipenv#3239

items.title: Bckport and extend the new temporary directory error handlers from cpython
items.body: See python/cpython#10320 -- this will improve error handling on cleanup by attempting to issue a `chflags` call which may help with cleanup of VCS indexes during finalizer detach

items.title: Additional text is added for ok and fail state
items.body:
In pipenv, following is the result when locking is succeed.

```
➜  test pipenv lock
Locking [dev-packages] dependencies...
✔ Success! Locking...
Locking [packages] dependencies...
✔ Success! Locking...
Updated Pipfile.lock (8bdc9e)!
```

It looks like ```Locking...``` is additional.

Following text is better.

```
➜  test pipenv lock
Locking [dev-packages] dependencies...
✔ Success! 
Locking [packages] dependencies...
✔ Success! 
Updated Pipfile.lock (8bdc9e)!
```

items.title: Standard output for dummy spinner is improperly encoded
items.body:
- Provide a construct for decoding tty output using native encodings
- Format dummy spinner output using it
- Provide exception formatter

items.title: Readonly path removals fail to set write bits in all cases
items.body:
- Recursively crawl the directory tree when setting paths
- Make sure to set all permissions for all users on all paths

items.title: Spinner fails to initialize colorama which results in control characters on non-utf8 terminals
Fix spinner compatibility
items.body:
- For both the normal and dummy spinners, prefer to write to `sys.stderr`
- Check for empty, None, and `"None"` before writing and either pass (dummy) or write an empty string
- Fix Signal Registration for windows

items.title: Fix terminal color string encoding compatibility for python 2
items.body: - Force native string encoding for all termcolors

items.title: Implement tracked named temporary files
items.body: - Similar to `create_tracked_tempdir`, allows for automatically cleaning up resources using weakreferences at interpreter exit

items.title: Suppress ResourceWarning when using create_tracked_tempdir
items.body: - When using a tracked temporary directory, resource warnings are non-native and therefore must be suppressed.

items.title: Always write output streams using filestystem format
items.body: - Don't assume unicode

items.title: Allow spinners to write to standard error
items.body: Spinners currently only provide a handle to stdout, but sometimes they need to write to stderr...
